intro: Horkelia webberi, commonly known as Webber's horkelia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the sunflower family (Asteraceae) and is characterized by its delicate, daisy-like flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils in arid or semi-arid environments. It produces small, yellow-orange blooms that attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Horkelia webberi is often found in open habitats like sagebrush steppe and is adapted to withstand drought conditions.
